node.title: Ex-Cyclone Cody could 'directly hit' New Zealand bringing rain, gales
node.description: Parts of the North Island are expected to bear the brunt.
node.content: ["A large weather system that's just left Fiji could directly impact New Zealand by early next week, bringing rain and gale-force winds with it, forecasters warn.\n", "The worst of Cyclone Cody is over for Fiji after hammering the Pacific Island nation earlier this week and WeatherWatch says it's now heading south away from the equator.", "Exactly how the cyclone will impact New Zealand remains unclear but it's on track to brush past the country later this week.", "\"While Cody will technically lose the 'tropical cyclone' part to the name by the time it reaches NZ, the storm itself may still be producing similar gales and rain,\" WeatherWatch said in a statement.", "\"The ex-cyclone is expected to then impact the North Island with a chance of a direct hit/landfall in the upper eastern North Island (East Cape or Bay of Plenty, for example).\"", "MetService said Cody could intensify to a category 2 or 3 tropical cyclone (TC).", "\"TC CODY is expected to move into TCWC (Tropical Cyclone Warning Centre) WELLINGTON area of responsibility during Thursday and is expected to track towards eastern North Island late Sunday or Monday,\" MetService said in its tropical cyclone activity bulletin.", "On Sunday, rain is expected to develop in Bay of Plenty - which will continue into Monday and westerly winds will arrive on Tuesday, MetService said.\u00a0", "One person died in Fiji during Cyclone Cody and widespread flooding caused the evacuation of almost 2000 people.\u00a0"]
